Enforcing the Law and bringing offenders swiftly to justice 1-40 PvM/E and PvP

Medieval Enforcer (Divine Blade)--Paladin(4), Fighter(14), Weapon Master(22)
By Deborah "Tyr" Templar

This build was first published in the ECB1 on July 29, 2006, and has been revisited in light of the 1.69 Patch. Essentially, a WM/Paladin with the high/PG melee AB, and exceptional damage output thanks to the WM crit. factor bolstered by Fighter (WS/EWS), Divine Might, and devastating crit (all the better to serve and protect the people, bringing offenders swiftly to justice) with nice saves thanks to Paladin Divine Grace (simply add Charisma for even more saves, and which nicely enhances damage (DM) and defense (DS), too). Main weakness is that the skills are a bit thin, but has what an Enforcer needs (actually quite decent for a melee, especially one with Pal in the mix!). What follows is the build:

*Don’t Want Devastating Critical? No Problem.
If uninterested in Dev.Crit, then drop Grt.Cleave, Epic Fort, OC and DC, taking IKD at level 18 (instead of Grt.Cleave), and delay your last level of fighter until level 31 (where you'll pick up EWS instead), running WM 4-13 from levels 21 through 30 instead (thus, taking EWF as WM boni feat (instead of OC), EWS as FTR 14 immediately after as noted), and grab Armor Skin (instead of DC); this, so as to pick up a Grt.Str at Lvl. 21 (where EWF currently is) and another at Lvl. 24 (where EF currently is), finishing on a STR 32, thus getting +1 AB/Damage (Natural melee AB 50), +2 AC (Naked AC 17; 28 mundane plate+shield) and IKD in lieu of Dev.Crit, or other feats of your own choosing.
